data.name: سُورَةُ القَمَرِ
data.englishBism: In the name of God, The Most Gracious, The Dispenser of Grace

ayahs.englishText: THE LAST HOUR draws near, and the moon is split asunder!
ayahs.arabicText: اقْتَرَبَتِ السَّاعَةُ وَانْشَقَّ الْقَمَرُ

ayahs.englishText: But if they [who reject all thought of the Last Hour] were to see a sign [of its approach], they would turn aside and say, “An ever-recurring delusion!” –
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنْ يَرَوْا آيَةً يُعْرِضُوا وَيَقُولُوا سِحْرٌ مُسْتَمِرٌّ

ayahs.englishText: for they are bent on giving it the lie, being always wont to follow their own desires. Yet everything reveals its truth in the end.
ayahs.arabicText: وَكَذَّبُوا وَاتَّبَعُوا أَهْوَاءَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلُّ أَمْرٍ مُسْتَقِرٌّ

ayahs.englishText: And withal, there has come unto them many a tiding that should have restrained [their arrogance]:
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُمْ مِنَ الْأَنْبَاءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزْدَجَرٌ

ayahs.englishText: far-reaching wisdom [was held out to them]: but [since] all warnings have been of no avail,
ayahs.arabicText: حِكْمَةٌ بَالِغَةٌ ۖ فَمَا تُغْنِ النُّذُرُ

ayahs.englishText: turn thou away from them. On the Day when the Summoning Voice will sum­mon [man] unto something that the mind cannot conceive,
ayahs.arabicText: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ ۘ يَوْمَ يَدْعُ الدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَيْءٍ نُكُرٍ

ayahs.englishText: they will come forth from their graves, with their eyes downcast, [swarming about] like locusts scattered [by the wind],
ayahs.arabicText: خُشَّعًا أَبْصَارُهُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمْ جَرَادٌ مُنْتَشِرٌ

ayahs.englishText: running in con­fusion towards the Summoning Voice; [and] those who [now] deny the truth will exclaim, “Calamitous is this Day!”
ayahs.arabicText: مُهْطِعِينَ إِلَى الدَّاعِ ۖ يَقُولُ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَسِرٌ

ayahs.englishText: [LONG] BEFORE those [who now deny resurrec­tion] did Noah’s people call it a lie; and they gave the lie to Our servant and said, “Mad is he!” - and he was repulsed.
ayahs.arabicText: ۞ كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ فَكَذَّبُوا عَبْدَنَا وَقَالُوا مَجْنُونٌ وَازْدُجِرَ

ayahs.englishText: Thereupon he called out to his Sustainer, “Verily, I am defeated; come Thou, then, to my succour!”
ayahs.arabicText: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَغْلُوبٌ فَانْتَصِرْ

ayahs.englishText: And so We caused the gates of heaven to open with water pouring down in torrents,
ayahs.arabicText: فَفَتَحْنَا أَبْوَابَ السَّمَاءِ بِمَاءٍ مُنْهَمِرٍ

ayahs.englishText: and caused the earth to burst forth with springs, so that the waters met for a purpose pre-ordained:
ayahs.arabicText: وَفَجَّرْنَا الْأَرْضَ عُيُونًا فَالْتَقَى الْمَاءُ عَلَىٰ أَمْرٍ قَدْ قُدِرَ

ayahs.englishText: but him We bore on that [vessel] made of [mere] planks and nails,
ayahs.arabicText: وَحَمَلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلْوَاحٍ وَدُسُرٍ

ayahs.englishText: and it floated under Our eyes: a recom­pense for him who had been rejected with ingratitude.
ayahs.arabicText: تَجْرِي بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَاءً لِمَنْ كَانَ كُفِرَ

ayahs.englishText: And, indeed, We have caused such [floating vessels] to remain forever a sign [of Our grace unto man]: who, then, is willing to take it to heart?
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ تَرَكْنَاهَا آيَةً فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

ayahs.englishText: And how severe is the suffering which I inflict when My warnings are disregarded!
ayahs.arabicText: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

ayahs.englishText: Hence, indeed, We made this Qur’an easy to bear in mind: who, then, is willing to take it to heart?
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

ayahs.englishText: TO THE TRUTH gave the lie [the tribe of] Ad: and how severe was the suffering which I inflicted when My warnings were disregarded!
ayahs.arabicText: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

ayahs.englishText: Behold, We let loose upon them a raging storm wind on a day of bitter misfortune:
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا فِي يَوْمِ نَحْسٍ مُسْتَمِرٍّ

ayahs.englishText: it swept the people away as though they were palm-trunks uprooted:
ayahs.arabicText: تَنْزِعُ النَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ مُنْقَعِرٍ

ayahs.englishText: for, how severe is the suffering which I inflict when My warnings are disregarded!
ayahs.arabicText: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

ayahs.englishText: Hence, indeed, We made this Qur’an easy to bear in mind: who, then, is willing to take it to heart?
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

ayahs.englishText: [AND the tribe of] Thamud gave the lie to all [Our] warnings;
ayahs.arabicText: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِالنُّذُرِ

ayahs.englishText: and they said: “Are we to follow one single mortal, one from among ourselves? In that case, behold, we would certainly sink into error and folly!
ayahs.arabicText: فَقَالُوا أَبَشَرًا مِنَّا وَاحِدًا نَتَّبِعُهُ إِنَّا إِذًا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ

ayahs.englishText: Why - on him alone from among all of us should a [divine] reminder have been bestowed? Nay, but he is a boastful liar!”
ayahs.arabicText: أَأُلْقِيَ الذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌ

ayahs.englishText: [And God said:] “On the morrow they will come to know who the boastful liar is!
ayahs.arabicText: سَيَعْلَمُونَ غَدًا مَنِ الْكَذَّابُ الْأَشِرُ

ayahs.englishText: Behold, [O Salih] We are letting loose this she-camel as a test for them; and thou but watch them, and contain thyself in patience.
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا مُرْسِلُو النَّاقَةِ فِتْنَةً لَهُمْ فَارْتَقِبْهُمْ وَاصْطَبِرْ

ayahs.englishText: And let them know that the water [of their wells] is to be divided between them, with each share of water equitably apportioned.”
ayahs.arabicText: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ أَنَّ الْمَاءَ قِسْمَةٌ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلُّ شِرْبٍ مُحْتَضَرٌ

ayahs.englishText: But they summoned their [boldest] companion, and he ventured [upon the evil deed], and cruelly slaughtered [the animal]:
ayahs.arabicText: فَنَادَوْا صَاحِبَهُمْ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ

ayahs.englishText: and how severe was the suffering which I inflicted when My warnings were disregarded!
ayahs.arabicText: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

ayahs.englishText: Behold, We let loose upon them one single blast [of Our punishment], and they became like the dried-up, crumbling twigs of a sheepfold.
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَكَانُوا كَهَشِيمِ الْمُحْتَظِرِ

ayahs.englishText: Hence, indeed, We made this Qur’an easy to bear in mind: who, then, is willing to take it to heart?
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

ayahs.englishText: LOT ’S PEOPLE [too] gave the lie to all [Our] warn­ings:
ayahs.arabicText: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ بِالنُّذُرِ

ayahs.englishText: [and so,] behold, We let loose upon them a deadly tempest; and only Lot ’s kinsfolk did We save at the break of dawn,
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حَاصِبًا إِلَّا آلَ لُوطٍ ۖ نَجَّيْنَاهُمْ بِسَحَرٍ

ayahs.englishText: as a blessing from Us: thus do We reward all who are grateful.
ayahs.arabicText: نِعْمَةً مِنْ عِنْدِنَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي مَنْ شَكَرَ

ayahs.englishText: For he had truly warned them of Our punishing might; but they stubbornly cast doubt on these warn­ings,
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَنْذَرَهُمْ بَطْشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوْا بِالنُّذُرِ

ayahs.englishText: and even demanded that he give up his guests [to them]: whereupon We deprived them of their sight [and thus told them, as it were]: “Taste, then, the suffering which I inflict when My warnings are disregarded!”
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ رَاوَدُوهُ عَنْ ضَيْفِهِ فَطَمَسْنَا أَعْيُنَهُمْ فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

ayahs.englishText: And, indeed, abiding suffering did befall them early on the morrow:
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ صَبَّحَهُمْ بُكْرَةً عَذَابٌ مُسْتَقِرٌّ

ayahs.englishText: “Taste, then, the suffering which I inflict when My warnings are disregarded!”
ayahs.arabicText: فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

ayahs.englishText: Hence, indeed, We made this Qur’an easy to bear in mind: who, then, is willing to take it to heart?
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

ayahs.englishText: Now surely, unto Pharaoh’s folk [too] came such warnings;
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَ آلَ فِرْعَوْنَ النُّذُرُ

ayahs.englishText: they, too, gave the lie to all Our messages: and thereupon We took them to task as only the Almighty, who determines all things, can take to task.
ayahs.arabicText: كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذْنَاهُمْ أَخْذَ عَزِيزٍ مُقْتَدِرٍ

ayahs.englishText: ARE, THEN, those of you who [now] deny the truth better than those others - or have you, per­chance, [been promised] immunity in the [ancient] books of [divine] wisdom?
ayahs.arabicText: أَكُفَّارُكُمْ خَيْرٌ مِنْ أُولَٰئِكُمْ أَمْ لَكُمْ بَرَاءَةٌ فِي الزُّبُرِ

ayahs.englishText: Or do they say, “We are a group united, [and therefore] bound to prevail”?
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ نَحْنُ جَمِيعٌ مُنْتَصِرٌ

ayahs.englishText: [Yet] the hosts [of those who deny the truth] shall be routed, and they shall turn their backs [in flight]!
ayahs.arabicText: سَيُهْزَمُ الْجَمْعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ الدُّبُرَ

ayahs.englishText: But nay - the Last Hour is the time when they shall truly meet their fate; and that Last Hour will be most calamitous, and most bitter:
ayahs.arabicText: بَلِ السَّاعَةُ مَوْعِدُهُمْ وَالسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ

ayahs.englishText: for, behold, those who are lost in sin [will at that time come to know that it is they who] were sunk in error and folly!
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ الْمُجْرِمِينَ فِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ

ayahs.englishText: On the Day when they shall be dragged into the fire on their faces, [they will be told:] “Taste now the touch of hell-fire!”
ayahs.arabicText: يَوْمَ يُسْحَبُونَ فِي النَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُوا مَسَّ سَقَرَ

ayahs.englishText: BEHOLD, everything have We created in due measure and proportion;
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَاهُ بِقَدَرٍ

ayahs.englishText: and Our ordaining [a thing and its coming into being] is but one [act], like the twinkling of an eye.
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا أَمْرُنَا إِلَّا وَاحِدَةٌ كَلَمْحٍ بِالْبَصَرِ

ayahs.englishText: Thus, indeed, did We destroy people like you [in the past]: who, then, is willing to take it to heart?
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَا أَشْيَاعَكُمْ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ

ayahs.englishText: [They were truly guilty] because all [the evil] that they ever did had been [revealed to them as such] in the [ancient] books of [divine] wisdom;
ayahs.arabicText: وَكُلُّ شَيْءٍ فَعَلُوهُ فِي الزُّبُرِ

ayahs.englishText: and everything [that man does], be it small or great, is recorded [with God].
ayahs.arabicText: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٍ وَكَبِيرٍ مُسْتَطَرٌ

ayahs.englishText: [Hence, too,] behold, the God-conscious will find themselves in [a paradise of] gardens and running waters,
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَهَرٍ

ayahs.englishText: in a seat of truth, in the presence of a Sovereign who determines all things.
ayahs.arabicText: فِي مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ عِنْدَ مَلِيكٍ مُقْتَدِرٍ
